intro: Bothriocline amphicoma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
